page.title: 11FORTHAMPTON POST OFFICE
page.content: The Post Office is found in Brewers Cottage in what was the bakery one generation ago. The mail is collected by van from Gloucester as there is no resident postman. Aswell as providing the usual services of a sub-Post Office, it is also the only village shop. The stock is small though it supplies basic needs, and what there is is stacked on the old wooden shelves. A freezer cabinet is the only modern device. Without the Post Office, the shop would not be economical since it is unable to compete with the shopping facilities in nearby Tewkesbury. These attract the local people as communications have improved. The Post Office and shop provide the second income of the family suggesting that business is slack.
